quotes.quote: Never mind searching for who you are. Search for the person you aspire to be.
You'll never find peace of mind until you listen to your heart.
I have been and still am a seeker, but I have ceased to question stars and books; I have begun to listen to the teaching my blood whispers to me.
The voyage of discovery is not in looking for new landscapes, but in looking with new eyes
For most men life is a search for the proper manila envelope in which to get themselves filed.
Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes.
All the wonders you seek are within yourself.
One of the greatest joys known to man is to take a flight into ignorance in search of knowledge.
Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
I think you travel to search and you come back home to find yourself there.
When you go in search of honey you must expect to be stung by bees.
And if you find everything as soon as you look for it, you find it in vain, you look for it in vain.
The only journey is the journey within.
If we're missing life it's probably because we're expecting it to reveal itself to us, rather than realizing that life is revealed by us looking for it.
You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
The way to find a needle in a haystack is to sit down.
The centre of me is always and eternally in terrible pain ... A searching for something beyond what the world contains, something transï¬guring and inï¬nite.
The greatest explorer on this earth never takes voyages as long as those of the man who descends to the depth of his heart.
What you discover on your own is always more exciting than what someone else discovers for you â€“ it's like the marriage between romantic love and an arranged marriage.
We are often taught to look for the beauty in all things, so in finding it, the layman asks the philosopher while the philosopher asks the photographer.
Truth waits to be found. It searches for no one.

Where you come from is gone, where you thought you were going to was never there, and where you are is no good unless you can get away from it. Where is there a place for you to be? No place... Nothing outside you can give you any place... In yourself right now is all the place you've got.
He did not waste time in a vain search for a place in history.
A man travels the world over in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
Go where you will, if a shilling can there be procured, you may expect to meet with individuals in search of it.
Better you don't search for who you are until you know who it is you want to find.
Between truth and the search for it, I choose the second.

Man is eminently a storyteller. His search for a purpose, a cause, an ideal, a mission and the like is largely a search for a plot and a pattern in the development of his life story -- a story that is basically without meaning or pattern.
The greater the step forward in knowledge, the greater is the one taken backward in search of wisdom.
The reason why we have never found measure of wealth. We never sought it.
